intro: Pedicularis transmorrisonensis, commonly known as Morrison's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of western North America. It belongs to the genus Pedicularis, which includes over 300 species of hemiparasitic plants. The plant has a distinctive appearance, featuring hairy stems and showy, reddish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or open habitats at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
